abstract.t: YANG lacks reusability of defined models oustide of the grouping and augmentation mechanism. For instance, it is almost impossible to reuse a model defined for a device in the context of the the network, i.e by encapsulating it in a list indexed by device IDs. YANG mount (RFC8528) solves the problem by allowing to include schemas at deploy or runtime. This document aims to provide the same mechanism at design time.

section.name: Introduction
section.t: RFC8528 introduces the challenge of reusing YANG models in a different context than the ones planned by the original owner. We focus here on the first use case identified in RFC8528, that is inserting modules at compile time.

section.name: Full Include
section.t: The full include mechanism defined in this document completes the use cases presented in RFC8528, providing a mechanism to support insertion of modules at compile time.

The "full-include" statement takes as an argument an identifier, refering to an imported module. Modules can contains multiple uses of the "full-include" statement. The "container" and "list" statements MAY contain multiple uses of the "full-include" statement on the same level, as long as they refer to different imported modules.
